sub_title: My work exists to help people embrace the art and science of collaboration (process) so they can spark up together and bring about healthier human societies and/or a healthier planet
summary:
Process ongoing change and change your process(es)!

I could tell you about the 20 or so years of experience as learning and change process specialist; about my deep expertise in group/process design & facilitation, knowledge management, strategic communication, change management, monitoring & evaluation. About my experience and interest in working with individuals, organisations and multi-stakeholder collaboratives. About my strong footing in non-profit development work in gender, agriculture, water/sanitation/hygiene [WASH] in Africa, Latin America, Europe.

But really, what matters is this: If you care about improving this world, and want to work on this with people in an intelligent and respectful manner (for each other and for the environment); if you want your folks to connect deeply, meaningfully, in collective intelligence and heart, I’m here to help! 

My mission is to help people, networks and organisations realise, value and use the power of collaboration & learning. I want to work with you and help understand, use and develop your collaboration capacity (your’ process literacy’) so you can connect with people deeply and effectively, across functions, disciplines and cultures. And particularly to get a crack at complex problems we can't address on our own...

My work is thus social: I want to help people connect, learn and transform themselves, the communities they are part of and discover new networks and ways of being and doing. For this I work with participatory facilitation and engagement techniques, face-to-face and online. I have managed, facilitated, trained, coached people and 150 groups (of 4 up to 300 people).  

My work is also analytical: I love concepts, strategies, processes and approaches; I engage in action-research, develop proposals, strategies, concept notes, working plans, tools, training materials, thought pieces, papers, articles and particularly blog posts around knowledge management/learning and group facilitation. 
 
I love languages and speak five of them at the moment (French, English, Dutch, Spanish, German) -
with some notions of Amharic (the main language in Ethiopia). 

My vision: a world where people realise their connection to the world and each other, become and help others become leaders through empathy, personal reflection and collaboration. Love, light and learning for a better world. 

More information on: http://km4meu.wordpress.com/about-me/

treasury_media.title: Demand-responsive research through learning alliances
treasury_media.description: I introduced this presentation during the session 6.2.2 of the World Water Forum 5 in Istanbul, on Friday 20 March. The presentation sketches the shortcomings of some research activities in development, proposes the learning alliance methodology and introduces some issues, opportunities and key challenges to come up with relevant research and sustainable development.

treasury_media.description:
Presentation given at the 5th World Water Forum about knowledge management and capacity development for the water sector. 
Touches upon challenges, definitions, opportunities and some reflections about learning

projects.title: African Chicken Genetic Gains
projects.description:
African Chicken Genetic Gains is an Africa-wide collaboration led by the International Livestock Research Institute. Partners from Ethiopia, the Netherlands, Nigeria and Tanzania will test and make available high-producing, farmer-preferred genotypes that increase smallholder chicken productivity in Africa. 
In this project I lead the communication and knowledge management component and facilitate large or strategic project meetings.

contributors.headline: My work exists to help people embrace the art and science of collaboration (process) so they can spark up together and bring about healthier human societies and/or a healthier planet

projects.title: Africa RISING
projects.description:
Through action research and development partnerships, Africa RISING will create opportunities for smallholder farm households to move out of hunger and poverty through sustainably intensified farming systems that improve food, nutrition, and income security, particularly for women and children, and conserve or enhance the natural resource base.
This program has a strong communication and knowledge sharing component, is relying on facilitated events and documentation of ongoing processes of innovation and decision-making.

projects.title: WASHTech
projects.description:
The WASHTech project (2011-2013) is involving local partners in Burkina Faso, Ghana and Uganda to introduce a robust Technology Applicability Framework (TAF) that will assess the potential of new innovative technologies which may be used at decentralised level. The TAF will examine key criteria such as: how the technology performs, whether buyers and users are interested in the technology (i.e. the market), whether the technology can be applied widely, what support is required from government and private sector institutions how sustainable the technology is over time.
Innovative work on very simple communication and on use of multi-stakeholder platforms (learning alliances) to influence policy and practice and develop a strong engagement process around the work in the three countries (Burkina Faso, Ghana, Uganda)

profile_positions.title: Knowledge management and communication advisor

profile_positions.description:
Team Leader Knowledge, Engagement and Collaboration
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
(Since July 2014) Leading the ILRI Communications sub-team on 'Knowledge, engagement and collaboration': strategic development and supervision of all engagement and collaboration activities: design, facilitation and (social) reporting of events; organizing and improving collaboration processes, information infrastructure and knowledge sharing process set up; stimulating engaging events and conversations; organizing consultation and co-creation processes online (via social media, campaigns and e-conversations) and offline (via meetings and events); organizing specifically ILRI internal communication processes and channels in support of other ILRI teams.
Managing a team of five people, of which three are under my direct supervision.

Knowledge Sharing and Communication specialist
-------------------------------------------------------------------
What? Knowledge sharing/management, communication and monitoring/evaluation.
How? Training, coaching, supervising, process & event facilitation, writing, strategic thinking. 
Where? At ILRI in Ethiopia and elsewhere, in ILRI and related CG projects.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader Knowledge, Engagement and Collaboration

company.name: Knowledge Management for Development (KM4Dev) core group

profile_positions.company: Knowledge Management for Development (KM4Dev) core group
profile_positions.description:
KM4DEV is a community of practitioners interested in developing knowledge management & learning initiatives, concepts, approaches and tools to enhance effectiveness of development interventions - knowledge management for development (KM4Dev). 
As part of the core group I help organise annual events: preparing, facilitating, documenting (in Zeist 2007, Almada 2008, Brussels 2009), I discuss strategic issues with the core group, contribute to developing proposals for additional funding, I participate to discussions on the mailing list and summarise a couple of discussions a year on the community wiki. I promote the community of practice in my work. 
I am also in charge of SA-GE, the French-speaking CoP related to KM4DEV.
profile_positions.title: Core group member

company.name: IRC International Water and Sanitation Centre

profile_positions.description:
My programme officer tasks include:

* Learning and knowledge management (KM)*:
Capacity development to establish and facilitate resource centre networks [information and knowledge sharing hubs for sector coordination] and learning alliances [networked multi-stakeholder platforms aimed at scaling up structural change around a thematic issue]: 
- project management, 
- coaching, 
- training, 
- conceptual development,  
- facilitation of KM workshops, 
- set up and facilitation of 5 communities of practice, 
- organisation and facilitation of KM4DEV annual workshops, 
- applied research on learning for the IKM Emergent programme, 
- writing papers, articles and blogging;

*Monitoring & evaluation*: 
Design of monitoring frameworks (embracing accountability to various parties and stimulating learning): for the RiPPLE programme (www.rippleethiopia.org), PSO programme for support to resource centre networks, WASHTech programme.

*Strategic communication*: for the RiPPLE programme in Ethiopia (co-heading the communication group), for the WASHTech programme, for IRC at large.
- developing communication strategies 
- developing social media engagement strategies
- support to other organisations (e.g. WaterAid Ethiopia, ARD)
- organising training and learning&sharing workshops, 
- writing articles, 
- blogging.
- developing publication and dissemination processes and a host of communication products & services (leaflets, websites, blogs, briefing notes etc.)
profile_positions.title: Programme Officer (Africa programme)

profile_positions.description:
My project officer tasks have included:
- Learning and knowledge management (KM) processes to establish resource centres and learning alliances (project management, coaching, training, conceptual development) facilitation of KM workshops, development of 5 communities of practice, organisation and facilitation of KM4DEV annual workshops, applied research on learning for the IKM Emergent programme, writing articles and blogging;
- Monitoring: Design of monitoring frameworks (accountability to donor AND internal learning): for the resource centre development (RCD) programme, for IRC and for the RIPPLE programme (www.rippleethiopia.org).
- Strategic communication: for the RiPPLE programme in Ethiopia (co-heading the communication group), for the WASHCost programme, for IRC at large and for the RCD section specifically, developing communication strategies for RiPPLE, WASHCost, 2 IRC regional programmes, support to WaterAid Ethiopia).
profile_positions.title: Project officer (Resource Centre Development section)

profile_positions.description:
(Within IRC, I occupy two positions, due to my openness for challenges and the opportunities for self-development provided by a rather small organization).

Coordination of all consultancies for advisory and training/capacity-building work; preparation of EU proposals and other large term projects, maintenance of a consultant database, networking with various organizations and consultants, research into funding streams available involving contact with major bilateral and multilateral donors.
